title.narrative: Emergency health assistance to mothers, newborns and children newly displaced from Khyber Agency residing in camps in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP)

description.narrative:
6. More than 80% of the targeted 1,344 pregnant women receive Tetanus Toxoid (TT) vaccination, ante-natal care, clean delivery kits, and newborn kits. 7. More than 80% of targeted 1,344 pregnant women are assisted through delivery by skilled birth attendants. 8. More than 70% of targeted 1,344 pregnant women undergo least one post natal visit with skilled birth attendants (SBAs) at the facility or community level. 9. More than 60% of 2,688 pregnant and lactating women receive health and hygiene messages through social mobilizers and facility-based health workers.
*** Start date backdated to 15/03/2012.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

name.narrative: Jalozai IDP camp located in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Emergency health assistance to mothers, newborns and children newly displaced from Khyber Agency residing in camps in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP)

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
